00039 /**

00042  *  @param  j [in] node j
00043  *  @param  dat [in] Concorde problem data structure

00050 /****************************************************************************
00051  * Public function implemenations
00052  ****************************************************************************/
00053 int
00054 arrow_problem_read(char *file_name, arrow_problem *problem)
00055 {    
00056     if(is_symmetric(file_name) == ARROW_TRUE)
00057     {    
00058         arrow_debug("Reading symmetric TSPLIB file...\n");
00059         int size;
00060         if(CCutil_gettsplib(file_name, &size, &(problem->data)) != 0)
00061         {
00062             arrow_print_error("Unable to read TSPLIB file using Concorde\n");
00063             return ARROW_FAILURE;
00064         }
00065         problem->size = size;
00066         problem->symmetric = ARROW_TRUE;
00067     }
00068     else if(is_asymmetric(file_name) == ARROW_TRUE)
00069     {
00070         arrow_debug("Reading asymmetric TSPLIB file...\n");
00071         if(read_atsp(file_name, problem) != ARROW_SUCCESS)
00072         {
00073             arrow_print_error("Unable to read ATSP file");
00074             return ARROW_FAILURE;
00075         }
00076         problem->symmetric = ARROW_FALSE;
00077     }
00078     else
00079     {
00080         arrow_print_error("Input file type not supported.");
00081         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00082     }
00083     
00084     /* Strip out the problem file name from the path */
00085     char *s = strrchr(file_name, '/');
00086     if(s != NULL)
00087         sprintf(problem->name, "%s", s + 1);
00088     else
00089         sprintf(problem->name, "%s", file_name);
00090     
00091     problem->shallow = ARROW_FALSE;
00092     problem->get_cost = arrow_problem_get_cost;
00093     
00094     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00095 }
00096 
00097 void
00098 arrow_problem_destruct(arrow_problem *problem)
00099 {
00100     if(!problem->shallow)
00101     {
00102         if(&(problem->data) != NULL)
00103         {
00104             CCutil_freedatagroup(&(problem->data));
00105         }
00106     }
00107     else
00108     {
00109         if(problem->data.userdat.data != NULL)
00110             free(problem->data.userdat.data);
00111     }
00112 }
00113 
00114 int
00115 arrow_problem_info_get(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info)
00116 {
00117     arrow_bintree tree;
00118     int ret;
00119     int i, j;
00120     int cost, min_cost, max_cost;
00121     
00122     ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00123     arrow_bintree_init(&tree);
00124     min_cost = INT_MAX;
00125     max_cost = INT_MIN;
00126         
00127     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00128     {
00129         j = (problem->symmetric == ARROW_TRUE ? i + 1 : 0);
00130         for(; j < problem->size; j++)
00131         {
00132             if(i != j)
00133             {
00134                 /* Add to binary tree */
00135                 cost = problem->get_cost(problem, i, j);
00136                 ret = arrow_bintree_insert(&tree, cost);
00137                 if(ret != ARROW_SUCCESS) goto CLEANUP;
00138             
00139                 /* Determine min and max costs */
00140                 if(cost < min_cost) min_cost = cost;
00141                 if(cost > max_cost) max_cost = cost;
00142             }
00143         }
00144     }
00145     
00146     /* Convert tree to array */
00147     arrow_bintree_to_array(&tree, &(info->cost_list));
00148     info->cost_list_length = tree.size;
00149     info->min_cost = min_cost;
00150     info->max_cost = max_cost;
00151     
00152 CLEANUP:
00153     arrow_bintree_destruct(&tree);
00154     return ret;
00155 }
00156 
00157 void
00158 arrow_problem_info_destruct(arrow_problem_info *info)
00159 {
00160     if(info->cost_list != NULL)
00161         free(info->cost_list);
00162 }

00164 void
00165 arrow_problem_print(arrow_problem *problem)
00166 {
00167     int i, j, k, count;
00168     int group_size = 8;
00169     
00170     printf("Problem Cost Matrix:\n");
00171     printf("----------------------------------------");
00172     printf("--------------------------------------\n");
00173     
00174     /* Print cost matrix out into groups so they will (normally) fit into
00175      * an 80-character width terminal. */
00176     k = 0;
00177     
00178     arrow_debug("Problem Size: %d\n", problem->size);
00179     while(k < problem->size)
00180     {
00181         /* Handle special case for last column */
00182         if(problem->size - k < group_size)
00183             count = problem->size - k;
00184         else
00185             count = group_size;
00186         
00187         /* Print out the header */
00188         for(j = k; j < k + count; j++)
00189             printf("\t[j=%d]", j);   
00190         printf("\n");
00191 
00192         /* Print out rows */
00193         for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00194         {
00195             printf("[i=%d]", i); fflush(stdin);
00196             for(j = k; j < k + count; j++)
00197             {
00198                 if(i == j)
00199                     printf("\t-");
00200                 else
00201                     printf("\t%d", problem->get_cost(problem, i, j));
00202                 fflush(stdin);
00203             }
00204             printf("\n");
00205         }
00206         printf("\n");
00207 
00208         k += count;
00209     }
00210 }
00211 
00212 inline int 
00213 arrow_problem_get_cost(arrow_problem *problem, int i, int j)
00214 {
00215     return problem->data.edgelen(i, j, &(problem->data));
00216 }

00218 int
00219 arrow_problem_read_tour(char *file_name, int size, int *tour)
00220 {
00221     if(CCutil_getcycle_tsplib(size, file_name, tour) == CONCORDE_SUCCESS)
00222         return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00223     else
00224         return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00225 }
00226 
00227 int
00228 arrow_problem_abtsp_to_sbtsp(arrow_problem *old_problem, int infinity, 
00229                              arrow_problem *new_problem)
00230 {
00231     int i, j;
00232     int n = old_problem->size;
00233     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00234 
00235     sprintf(new_problem->name, "%s", old_problem->name);
00236     new_problem->shallow = ARROW_FALSE;
00237     new_problem->size = n * 2;
00238     new_problem->symmetric = ARROW_TRUE;
00239     new_problem->get_cost = arrow_problem_get_cost;
00240     
00241     CCdatagroup *dat = &(new_problem->data);
00242     
00243     ret = arrow_util_CCdatagroup_init_matrix(n * 2, dat);
00244     if(ret != ARROW_SUCCESS)
00245     {
00246         arrow_print_error("Could not create CCdatagroup matrix");
00247         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00248     }
00249 
00250     for(i = 0; i < new_problem->size; i++)
00251     {
00252         for(j = 0; j <= i; j++)
00253         {
00254             if((i < n) || (j >= n))
00255                 dat->adj[i][j] = infinity;
00256             else if(i == j + n)
00257                 dat->adj[i][j] = -1 * infinity;
00258             else
00259                 dat->adj[i][j] = old_problem->get_cost(old_problem, j, i - n);
00260         }
00261     }
00262     
00263     return ret;
00264 }

00266 
00267 /****************************************************************************
00268  * Private function implementations
00269  ****************************************************************************/
00270 /* These regular expressions check to see if the given file name ends
00271    with tsp (for symmetric TSPLIB files) or atsp (for asymmetric TSPLIB
00272    files).  Someday, perhaps, I'll bother to actually read the TSPLIB
00273    file to see what the TYPE is rather than go by the file extension. */
00274 int
00275 is_symmetric(char *file_name)
00276 {
00277     return arrow_util_regex_match(file_name, "(.*\\.([tT][sS][pP])$)");
00278 }
00279 
00280 int
00281 is_asymmetric(char *file_name)
00282 {
00283     return arrow_util_regex_match(file_name, "(.*\\.([aA][tT][sS][pP])$)");
00284 }
00285 
00286 int
00287 read_atsp(char *file_name, arrow_problem *problem)
00288 {
00289     /* This code is mostly borrowed (stolen?) from Concorde's routine,
00290        so credit to the Concorde guys who dealing with the pain of reading
00291        TSPLIB files in C. */
00292     char buf[256], key[256], field[256];
00293     char *p;
00294     FILE *in;
00295     int norm, i, j;
00296     CCdatagroup *dat = &(problem->data);
00297     
00298     if(!(in = fopen(file_name, "r"))) 
00299     {
00300         arrow_print_error("Unable to open file for input\n");
00301         return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00302     }
00303     
00304     CCutil_init_datagroup(dat);
00305     
00306     while(fgets(buf, 254, in) != (char *)NULL)
00307     {
00308         p = buf;
00309         while (*p != '\0')
00310         {
00311             if (*p == ':') *p = ' ';
00312             p++;
00313         }
00314         p = buf;
00315         
00316         if(sscanf(p, "%s", key) != EOF)
00317         {
00318             p += strlen(key);
00319             while(*p == ' ') p++;
00320             
00321             if(!strcmp (key, "NAME"))
00322             {
00323                 arrow_debug("Problem Name: %s", p);
00324             }
00325             else if(!strcmp (key, "TYPE"))
00326             {
00327                 arrow_debug("Problem Type: %s", p);
00328                 if(sscanf(p, "%s", field) == EOF || strcmp (field, "ATSP"))
00329                 {
00330                     arrow_print_error("Not an ATSP problem");
00331                     return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00332                 }
00333             } 
00334             else if(!strcmp (key, "COMMENT"))
00335             {
00336                 arrow_debug("%s", p);
00337             } 
00338             else if(!strcmp (key, "DIMENSION"))
00339             {
00340                 if(sscanf(p, "%s", field) == EOF)
00341                 {
00342                     arrow_print_error("ERROR in DIMENSION line");
00343                     return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00344                 }
00345                 problem->size = atoi(field);
00346                 arrow_debug("Number of Nodes: %d\n", problem->size);
00347             }
00348             else if(!strcmp (key, "EDGE_WEIGHT_TYPE"))
00349             {
00350                 if(sscanf(p, "%s", field) == EOF)
00351                 {
00352                     arrow_print_error("ERROR in EDGE_WEIGHT_TYPE line");
00353                     return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00354                 }
00355                 if(!strcmp(field, "EXPLICIT")) {
00356                     printf ("Explicit Lengths (CC_MATRIXNORM)\n");
00357                     norm = CC_MATRIXNORM;
00358                 }
00359                 else
00360                 {
00361                     arrow_print_error("ERROR: Not set up for given norm");
00362                     return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00363                 }
00364                 
00365                 if(CCutil_dat_setnorm(dat, norm)) 
00366                 {
00367                     arrow_print_error("Could not setup MAXTRIXNORM");
00368                     return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00369                 }
00370                 dat->edgelen = fullmatrix_edgelen;
00371             }
00372             else if(!strcmp (key, "EDGE_WEIGHT_FORMAT"))
00373             {
00374                 if(sscanf (p, "%s", field) == EOF)
00375                 {
00376                     arrow_print_error("ERROR in EDGE_WEIGHT_FORMAT line");
00377                     return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00378                 }
00379                 if(strcmp(field, "FULL_MATRIX"))
00380                 {
00381                     arrow_print_error("Cannot handle edge weight format");
00382                     return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00383                 }
00384             }
00385             else if(!strcmp(key, "EDGE_WEIGHT_SECTION"))
00386             {
00387                 if(problem->size < 1) {
00388                     arrow_print_error("Dimension not specified");
00389                     return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00390                 }
00391                 if(dat->adj != (int **)NULL)
00392                 {            
00393                     arrow_print_error("A second NODE_COORD_SECTION?");
00394                     CCutil_freedatagroup(dat);
00395                     return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00396                 }
00397                 if ((norm & CC_NORM_SIZE_BITS) == CC_MATRIX_NORM_SIZE)
00398                 {
00399                     dat->adj = CC_SAFE_MALLOC(problem->size, int *);
00400                     dat->adjspace = 
00401                         CC_SAFE_MALLOC(problem->size * problem->size, int);
00402 
00403                     if(dat->adj == (int **) NULL ||
00404                         dat->adjspace == (int *) NULL) 
00405                     {
00406                         arrow_print_error("Could not setup adj/adjspace");
00407                         CCutil_freedatagroup(dat);
00408                         return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00409                     }
00410                     
00411                     for(i = 0, j = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00412                     {
00413                         dat->adj[i] = dat->adjspace + j;
00414                         j += problem->size;
00415                     }
00416                     
00417                     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00418                     {
00419                         for(j = 0; j < problem->size; j++)
00420                         {
00421                             fscanf(in, "%d", &(dat->adj[i][j]));
00422                         }
00423                     }
00424                 }
00425             }
00426             else if(!strcmp(key, "NODE_COORD_SECTION"))
00427             {
00428                 arrow_print_error("Encountered NODE_COORD_SECTION\n");
00429                 return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00430             }
00431             else if(!strcmp(key, "FIXED_EDGES_SECTION"))
00432             {
00433                 arrow_print_error("Not set up for fixed edges\n");
00434                 return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00435             }
00436         }
00437     }
00438     
00439     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00440 }
00441 
00442 static int
00443 fullmatrix_edgelen(int i, int j, CCdatagroup *dat)
00444 {
00445     return dat->adj[i][j];
00446 }
